did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, publications, photographs, videotapes, phonographs, CD's, DVD’s, scrapbooks, memorabilia, and artifacts.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Records created or assembled by the Rotary Club of Ithaca, New York. Including correspondence, publications, and material related to the functioning and activities of the club.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Ithaca Rotary Club was founded in 1914 by Edward G. Wyckoff, a prominent Ithaca businessman inspired by the Rotary movement and its ideals of fellowship and service. The club was the first Rotary club in the country founded without sponsorship from an established club, and it did not fully join the broader Rotary International organization until 1915. Ithaca Rotary has sponsored programs such as the Student Exchange, and has supported numerous organizations and causes, both throughout the Ithaca community and internationally. Ithaca Rotary has also sponsored the formation of additional Rotary clubs, including the Ithaca Sunrise Rotary Club, the Ithaca-Cayuga Rotary Club, and clubs in Dryden and Trumansburg, NY. Women have been members of Ithaca Rotary since Rotary International first allowed women in 1987. For more information, please see Margaret Hobbie's A BRIEF HISTORY OF THE ITHACA ROTARY CLUB (1995), Box 17, folder 15.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records created or assembled by the Rotary Club of Ithaca, New York. The collection includes correspondence, reports, minutes, memoranda, bylaws, secretarial and presidential files, membership records, Board of Directors records, annual reports, financial records, photographs, audiovisual material, oral histories, and a scrapbook. Publications of the Ithaca Rotary Club include bound and unbound issues of THE ROTARY CLUB NEWS (weekly publication), and pamphlets. The collection contains additional publications such as newsletters, convention proceedings and books from Rotary International, newsletters from Rotary Districts, publications from other Rotary clubs and a songbook. Audiovisual material consists of a videotape, CDs, floppy disks, DVDs and a phonograph. Ephemera and memorabilia include plaques, certificates, news clippings, and miscellaneous artifacts.

The majority of material in this collection dates from the 1950’s through 1980’s. A few items date back to the founding and early years of the organization. More recent material consists largely of photographs, meeting minutes and issues of THE ROTARY CLUB NEWS.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Ithaca Rotary Club Records, #3067. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series VII. Ithaca Rotary Club Publications

scopecontent.p: Contains records pertaining to the administration of the Ithaca Rotary Club.

scopecontent.p: Includes dated and undated rosters and membership cards, loose pages from rosters, and information gathered for creating the rosters.
Board of Directors meeting minutes. Also includes some material presented to the Board, including correspondence and financial reports.

did.unittitle: Board of Director Minutes and account balances

scopecontent.p: The series consists largely of material from presidents’ notebooks/workbooks, including correspondence, material for the Board of Directors, budgets, reports and committee materials.
Includes material pertaining to the formation of the Ithaca-Cayuga Club.

Contains the files assembled by secretaries of the Ithaca Rotary Club. These files cover a broad range of subjects, including membership and attendance, committees, club programming, material related to specific presidents and treasurers, and material pertaining to Rotary in a broader sense, including Rotary International, the Rotary Foundation, and the various Rotary districts of which Ithaca Rotary has been a member.

This series begins with material from Earl Atkinson (1923-1946) and Frank Philipps (1946). It also includes material from a time of secretarial transition (1968-1974). When Secretary Frank R. Bliss died suddenly in 1970, several secretaries held the post in quick succession, including Clarence W. Mitchell, William H. Allen, Jr., and Robert “Bob” Head. Unlike other secretarial files, which are arranged according to secretary, the organizer of these files sorted them by years and topics, combining material from Bliss and the secretaries who followed him within each file. Finally, the series also includes one box of files (1944-1967) organized alphabetically rather than by subject. For instance, a file labeled “T” could contain material from the club treasurer, correspondents whose name begins with T, etc. This material is largely from Ollie Jones’ tenure, but also includes some material from Frank Philipps' time as secretary.

Jones was secretary of Ithaca Rotary from 1946-1963, and again from 1964-1966. In 1963-1964, he was District Governor of Rotary International District 717. This series contains some of his files as District Governor, as well as those during his transition back to his role as secretary of Ithaca Rotary.
Bliss became secretary while Ollie Jones was District Governor, leaving the post on Jones’ return, and resuming it in 1966. He died while still secretary of the club in 1970.
Bob Head’s files comprise the largest set of secretarial files in the collection.
Committee documents
Programming Committee
Club social activities and committees

Ithaca Rotary has been part of various Rotary districts since its foundation. These files include material from Districts 187, 253, 254, 717 and 7170. Material includes Ithaca Rotary Annual Club Assembly reports to the district, district newsletters, district conference materials and correspondence.
-newsletters are on a CD [CD-2220]

did.unittitle: Ithaca Rotary Club District - Pass the Gavel

scopecontent.p: Material related to the Ithaca Rotary Club’s fundraising for the Rotary Foundation, and to programs sponsored through the Foundation, including the Group Study Exchange. Includes correspondence, certificates, publications and reports.
Includes a note written in 1995, explaining the materials

did.unittitle: Series VII. Ithaca Rotary Club Publications

scopecontent.p: Includes the weekly Ithaca Rotary Club publication, entitled THE ROTARY CLUB NEWS. Later issues carry the title of THE NEWS, but all issues of the publication are bound together in the collection under the title THE ROTARY CLUB NEWS. The collection includes both bound and loose issues, along with other Ithaca Rotary pamphlets and publications.

did.unittitle: Rotary Club News and The News (Unbound)
The News and Rotary Club News (Unbound)--Misc.

scopecontent.p: Loose supplements and issues
Labeled as Vol. 41, but also includes the first part of 42
Labeled as Vol. 43, but also includes the second part of 42
Rotary International publications, including conference proceedings. Also includes Ithaca Rotary Club files related to both Rotary International and to fellow Rotary clubs.

did.unittitle: From a Yankee Notebook in Taiwan

scopecontent.p: Contains DVD’s, CD's, floppy disks, a videocassette, and a phonograph record. The DVD’s include a series of Oral History interviews conducted with Ithaca Rotary Members in 2004. Interviewees include Jack Burns, Bob Eastman, Barbara Caldwell, Carman Hill, Gene Erickson, Bob and Dale Baker, John Seeley and Bob Yong, Dale Flinn, Dave Flinn, Barbara Thuesen, Barlow Ware, Don Kompf, Bill Downing, and Fred Antil.
Includes labeled and unlabeled photographs, both loose and in albums. Includes both black and white and color shots.
